TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s wife filed for divorce .

CARDINAL . After several hearings , on CARDINAL DATE the Budapest II / III ORG dissolved the parties’ marriage , and ordered the applicant to pay maintenance for the couple ’s daughter in the amount of MONEY ( ORG ) , which included arrears . The court allowed no suspensive effect for any appeal on the maintenance decision . The use of the couple ’s flat was granted to the wife alone .

CARDINAL . NORP On appeal , ORG held CARDINAL hearings and obtained the opinion of a real - estate valuation expert . On DATE the court amended the first instance decision , holding that the applicant was entitled to compensation in the amount of MONEY , which corresponded to his share of the flat . It ordered that this liability be taken into account when ORG , in the resumed proceedings , would eventually decide on the division of the matrimonial property .
CARDINAL . On DATE execution was ordered . On DATE the applicant was evicted from the family flat . On DATE his car was attached , apparently in order to recover maintenance still owed .

CARDINAL . The proceedings in respect of the remainder of the parties’ common property were resumed before ORG on DATE . DATE and DATE numerous hearings took place , and the case was extended to include several further respondents .
CARDINAL . According to the information provided by the parties and the elements available in the case file to date , the case has not yet ended .
